name: Accelerated Beta Test
text: When you score Accelerated Beta Test, you may look at the top 3 cards of R&D. If any of those cards are ice, you may install and rez them, ignoring all costs. Trash the rest of the cards you looked at.

name: Access to Globalsec
text: +1 [Link]
flavor: He flicked the display population to high, and was surrounded by a circle of floating holos. The ping-back was strong, the clearance level blue-one. Now to find the perfect place for a relay...

name: Account Siphon
text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may force the Corp to lose up to 5 [Credits], then you gain 2 [Credits] for each credit lost and take 2 tags.

name: Adonis Campaign
text:
Put 12 [Credits] from the bank on Adonis Campaign when rezzed. When there are no credits left on this card, trash it.
Take 3 [Credits] from Adonis Campaign when your turn begins.

name: Aesop's Pawnshop
text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards to gain 3 [Credits].
flavor: You didn't mention Aesop's arm unless you wanted an earful. Sometimes he talked about it in such a way that you wondered why he didn't laser his other arm off as well.

name: Aggressive Negotiation
text:
Play only if you scored an agenda this turn.
Search R&D for 1 card and add it to HQ.
Shuffle R&D.
flavor: "I believe you'll find the terms are quite favorable."

name: Aggressive Secretary
text:
Aggressive Secretary can be advanced.
If you pay 2 [Credits] when the Runner accesses Aggressive Secretary, trash 1 program for each advancement token on Aggressive Secretary.

name: Akamatsu Mem Chip
text: +1 [Memory Unit]
flavor: The Akamatsu company was founded on three principles: first, to make the fastest mem chips on the market, second, to turn a profit, and third, to serve as a front for the manufacture of illegal neural-stimulants. It is the last principle that perhaps explains their rabid brand loyalty.

name: Akitaro Watanabe
text: The rez cost of ice protecting this server is lowered by 2.
flavor: Just don't ask how he does it.

name: Alix T4LB07
text:
Place 1 power counter on Alix T4LB07 whenever you install a card.
[Click], [Trash]: Gain 2 [Credits] for each power counter on Alix T4LB07.
flavor: The Alix model was based on a successful hedge fund manager but she had a tendency to burn out. Literally.

name: All-nighter
text: [Click], [Trash]: Gain [Click] [Click].
flavor: "I don't care what the studies show. From  my experience, I can ingest three cans of Diesel an hour for up to twelve hours before going into cardiac arrest." - heard during the eleventh hour

name: Amazon Industrial Zone
text:
Whenever you install a piece of ice protecting this server, you may immediately rez it, lowering its rez cost by 3.
Limit 1 region per server.

name: Andromeda: Dispossessed Ristie
text: You draw a starting hand of 9 cards.
flavor: "I run with the best."

name: Anonymous Tip
text: Draw 3 cards.
flavor: "Please stay connected. Priority transfer in progress. An operator will shortly verif-"

name: Archer
text:
As an additional cost to rez Archer, the Corp must forfeit an agenda.
[Subroutine] The Corp gains 2 [Credits].
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] End the run.
flavor: Next time, read the Terms of Service more carefully. Or you might find yourself in the danger zone.

name: Archived Memories
text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
flavor: "Do you think they... feel it?"

name: Armitage Codebusting
text:
Place 12 [Credits] from the bank on Armitage Codebusting when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Armitage Codebusting, trash it.

[Click]: Take 2 [Credits] from Armitage Codebusting.
flavor: Drudge work, but it pays the bills.

name: Ash 2X3ZB9CY
text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, trace4 - if successful, the Runner cannot access any cards other than Ash 2X3ZB9CY for the remainder of this run.
flavor: "Eyes forward please."

name: AstroScript Pilot Program
text:
Place 1 agenda counter on AstroScript Pilot Program when you score it.

Hosted agenda counter: Place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced.

name: Atman
text:
When you install Atman, you may pay X [Credits] to place X power counters on Atman.
Atman has +1 strength for each power counter on it.
1 [Credits]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has strength equal to Atman's strength.
flavor: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think.

name: Aurora
text:
2 [Credits]: Break barrier subroutine.
2 [Credits]: +3 strength.

name: Awakening Center
text:
Awakening Center can host bioroid ice (each piece of ice installed facedown, ignoring all install costs).
Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, you may rez a piece of ice on Awakening Center, lowering the rez cost by 7 [Credits], to force the Runner to encounter it. Trash that ice after the run is completed.

name: Bank Job
text:
Place 8 [Credits] from the bank on Bank Job when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Bank Job, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on a remote server, instead of accessing cards you may take any number of credits from Bank Job.

name: Bastion
text: [Subroutine] End the Run.
flavor: The principle behind ice is not to keep everyone out, but to let only some people in. This ice denies entry on all but a select few ports that might change with the time of day or picosecond of a connection. If you don't know what port to use, you're not getting in. Period.

name: Battering Ram
text:
2 [Credits]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines.
1 [Credits]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
flavor: "It's called 'brute-forcing' and it's just as effective today as it was a hundred years ago." - Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

name: Beanstalk Royalties
text: Gain 3 [Credits].
flavor: The New Angeles Space Elevator, better known as the Beanstalk, is the single greatest triumph of human engineering and ingenuity in history. The Beanstalk makes Earth orbit accessible to everyone... for a small fee.

name: Bernice Mai
text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, trace5 - if successful, give the Runner 1 tag. If unsuccessful, trash Bernice Mai.
flavor: Keeping tabs on the world, one screen at a time.

name: Big Brother
text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Give the Runner 2 tags.
flavor: Looking out for your interests since 1984.

name: Bioroid Efficiency Research
text: Rez a piece of bioroid ice, ignoring all costs, and install Bioroid Efficiency Research on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash Bioroid Efficiency Research and derez host ice if all of its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."

name: Biotic Labor
text: Gain [Click] [Click].
flavor: "Why of course, we have six different Haas-Bioroid models serving in a variety of positions at this branch office alone. We here at Haas-Bioroid aren't going to shy away from practicing what we preach, and we pass the savings from increased efficiency on to our valued customers."

name: Bishop
text:
[Click]: Host Bishop on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Bishop can be hosted only on ice protecting a central server if Bishop is on ice protecting a remote server, or on ice protecting a remote server if Bishop is on ice protecting a central server.
Host ice has -2 strength.

name: Borrowed Satellite
text:
+1 [Link]
Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
flavor: Some people have their own satellite receiver. Others have their own satellite.

name: Braintrust
text:
When you score Braintrust, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
The rez cost of all ice is lowered by 1 for each agenda counter on Braintrust.

name: Breaking News
text:
When you score Breaking News, give the Runner 2 tags.

When the turn on which you scored Breaking News ends, the Runner loses 2 tags.

name: Bullfrog
text: [Subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0 [Credits], 1 [Credits], or 2 [Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, move Bullfrog so that it is the outermost piece of ice protecting another server (the Runner continues the run from this new position and is now running on this new server).

name: Burke Bugs
text: [Subroutine]Trace0 - If successful, the Runner trashes 1 program.
flavor: "If I had to describe the bugs in one word, it would be '****ing annoying.'" -Whizzard

name: Caduceus
text:
[Subroutine] Trace3 - If successful, the Corp gains 3[Credits].
[Subroutine] Trace2 - If successful, end the run.
flavor: A symbol of commerce, but beware its bite.

name: Celebrity Gift
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ to the Runner. Gain 2 [Credits] for each card revealed.
flavor: When Miranda Rhapsody showed up with a teacup giraffe, suddenly everybody wanted one.

name: Cell Portal
text: [Subroutine] The Runner approaches the outermost piece of ice protecting the attacked server. Derez Cell Portal.
flavor: "Where does it go?"

name: Cerebral Imaging: Infinite Frontiers
text: Your maximum hand size is equal to the number of credits in your credit pool.
flavor: The densest information cluster in the galaxy.

name: Cerebral Overwriter
text:
Cerebral Overwriter can be advanced.
If you pay 3 [Credits] when the Runner accesses Cerebral Overwriter, do 1 brain damage for each advancement token on Cerebral Overwriter.

name: Chakana
text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Chakana.
If there are at least 3 virus counters on Chakana, the advancement requirement of all agendas is increased by 1.

name: Chaos Theory: Wunderkind
text: +1 [Memory Unit]
flavor: "Have you met Dinosaurus?"

name: Character Assassination
text: When you score Character Assassination, trash 1 resource (cannot be prevented).
flavor: "The thing about journalism is there's always a better story around the corner. Soon, they smelled blood elsewhere, and the world forgot about me. But I didn't forget." - The Professor

name: ChiLo City Grid
text:
Whenever there is a successful trace during a run on this server, give the Runner 1 tag.
Limit 1 region per server.
flavor: Clones whisper of ChiLo as a promised land of freedom.

name: Chimera
text:
When you rez Chimera, choose sentry, code gate, or barrier. Chimera gains that subtype until derezzed.
When a turn ends, derez Chimera.
[Subroutine] End the run.
flavor: Three heads. One big headache.

name: Chum
text: The next piece of ice the Runner encounters during this run has +2 strength. Do 3 net damage unless the Runner breaks all subroutines on that piece of ice.
flavor: "You ever get that feeling like you're shark food? Pay attention to that feeling." - Ji "Noise" Reilly

name: Cloak
text:
1 [Recurring Credits]
Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers.
flavor: "No line that they lay could catch a shadow on the wall..."

name: Clone Chip
text: [Trash]: Install a program from your heap (paying the install cost).
flavor: It is good practice to backup the backup.

name: Clone Retirement
text:
When you score Clone Retirement, you may remove 1 bad publicity.
When the Runner steals Clone Retirement, the Corp takes 1 bad publicity.
flavor:
"They call it 'retirement.' I call it euthanasia.' "
-Ken "Express" Tenma

name: Closed Accounts
text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner loses all credits in his or her credit pool.

name: Commercialization
text: Choose a piece of ice. Gain 1 [Credits] for each advancement token on that ice.
flavor: The Division of Fringe Applications' revenue increased 37% year-over-year after corporate discovered that most of their projects made really fun toys.

name: Compromised Employee
text:
1 [Recurring Credits]
Use this credit during traces.
Gain 1 [Credits] whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice.

name: Copycat
text: Whenever you pass a piece of ice, you may trash Copycat. If you do, choose another rezzed copy of that piece of ice protecting any server. The run continues as if you had just passed the chosen piece of ice (you are now running from this new position).
flavor: The copycat function should be used with extreme caution, or you might end up on the wrong side of cyberspace.

name: Corporate Troubleshooter
text: X [Credits], [Trash]: Choose a piece of rezzed ice protecting this server. That ice has +X strength until the end of the turn.
flavor: "I solve problems."

name: Corporate War
text: If you have at least 7 [Credits] when you score Corporate War, gain 7 [Credits]; otherwise, lose all credits in your credit pool.
flavor: There were several ways to win a corporate war. One of them was to bring the bazookas.

name: Corroder
text:
1 [Credits]: Break barrier subroutine.
1 [Credits]: +1 strength.
flavor: "If at first you don't succeed, boost its strength and try again." - g00ru

name: Cortez Chip
text: [Trash]: Choose a piece of ice. The Corp must pay 2 [Credits] as an additional cost to rez that ice until the end of the turn.
flavor: Named after Hernando Cortez, a former Weyland technician convicted of smuggling company tech. He still collected his pension while in prison, the last beneficiary of a loophole in Weyland's standard employment contract.

name: Crash Space
text:
2 [Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to pay for removing tags.
[Trash]: Prevent up to 3 meat damage.
flavor: "My roomie, he had a cousin with a college girlfriend whose brother's best friend was an addict, and the addict's mother used to live here. So yeah, there's a connection."

name: Creeper
text:
If you have at least 2 [Link], the memory cost of Creeper is 0, even if it is not installed.
2 [Credits]: Break sentry subroutine.
1 [Credits]: + strength.
flavor: "The itsy bitsy spider went up the data spout..." - Chaos Theory

name: Crescentus
text: [Trash]: Derez a piece of ice. Use this ability only after breaking all subroutines of that ice during a single encounter.
flavor: Cyberspace's strongest glue.

name: Crypsis
text:
1 [Credits]: Break ice subroutine.
1 [Credits]: +1 strength.
[Click]: Place 1 virus counter on Crypsis.
When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Crypsis to break a subroutine ends, remove 1 hosted virus counter or trash Crypsis.

name: Custom Biotics: Engineered for Success
text: You cannot include Jinteki cards in this deck.
flavor: The Once and Future Android.

name: Cyber-Cypher
text:
1 [Credits]: Break code gate subroutine.
1 [Credits]: +1 strength.
When you install Cyber-Cypher, choose a server. Cyber-Cypher can be used only during a run on the chosen server.

name: Cyberdex Trial
text: Purge virus counters.
flavor: Your free trial has expired. Upgrade to the full version?

name: Cyberfeeder
text:
1 [Recurring Credits]
Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs
flavor: I feel almost naked without it

name: Dagger
text:
1 [Credits]: Break sentry subroutine.
1 [Credits]: +5 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.
flavor: "... and once the shadow rises, the curtain shall fall." - revenant

name: Daily Casts
text:
Place 8 [Credits] from the bank on Daily Casts when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Daily Casts, trash it.
Take 2 [Credits] from Daily Casts when your turn begins.
flavor: "We say 'cyber-terrorist'; they hear 'underground celebrity.'" - Michael Muhama, professional expert

name: Darwin
text:
2 [Credits]: Break ice subroutine.
X is the number of virus counters on Darwin.
When your turn begins, you may pay 1 [Credits] to place 1 virus counter on Darwin.

name: Data Dealer
text: Forfeit an agenda, [Click]: Gain 9 [Credits].
flavor: Shadier the dealer, better the price. Unless the dealer's too shady. Then there might be a hidden fee after they take your scrip.

name: Data Hound
text: [Subroutine] Trace2 - If successful, look at a number of cards from the top of the Runner's stack equal to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded his or her link strength. Trash 1 of those cards, and arrange the rest in any order.
flavor: Sniff.

name: Data Leak Reversal
text:
Install only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
If you are tagged, Data Leak Reversal gains "[Click]: The Corp trashes the top card of R&D."
flavor: A two-way solution to a one-way problem, the data leak reversal, or DLR for short, is a misnomer. There is no actual reversal of data, only the creation of a parallel peer-to-peer link with the initial source.

name: Data Mine
text: [Subroutine] Do 1 net damage. Trash Data Mine.
flavor: Access HarmlessFile.datZ -> Are you sure? y/n

name: Data Raven
text:
When the Runner encounters Data Raven, he or she must either take 1 tag or end the run.

Hosted power counter: Give the Runner 1 tag.
[Subroutine] Trace3 - If successful, place 1 power counter on Data Raven.

name: Datapike
text:
[Subroutine] The Runner must pay 2 [Credits], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 2 [Credits], end the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
flavor: "Cheap off-the-shelf data protection. Cheap for them, that is. Not for us." - Ele "Smoke" Scovak

name: Datasucker
text:
Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker.

Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.

name: Decoy
text: [Trash]: Avoid receiving 1 tag.
flavor:
"I get the feeling that this is the wrong place, Frank."
"What makes you say that D?"
"The curlers."

name: Dedicated Response Team
text: If the Runner is tagged, Dedicated Response Team gains "Whenever a successful run ends, do 2 meat damage."
flavor: They don't call them dedicated for nothing.

name: Dedicated Server
text:
2 [Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to rez ice.
flavor:
so very still, even
cherry blossoms are not stirred
by the temple bell
-Fuhaku

name: Deep Thought
text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Deep Thought.
If there are at least 3 virus counters on Deep Thought, it gains "When your turn begins, you may look at the top card of R&D."

name: Deja Vu
text: Add 1 card (or up to 2 virus cards) from your heap to your grip.
flavor: Anything worth doing is worth doing twice.

name: Demolition Run
text: Make a run on HQ or R&D. You may trash, at no cost, any cards you access (even if the cards cannot normally be trashed).
flavor: You ever set something on fire just to watch it burn?

name: Desperado
text:
+1 [Memory Unit]

Gain 1 [Credits] whenever you make a successful run.

Limit 1 console per player.

name: Deus X
text:
[Trash]: Break any number of AP subroutines.
[Trash]: Prevent any amount of net damage.
flavor: Didn't see that coming.

name: Diesel
text: Draw 3 cards.
flavor: Diesel gives you flames.

name: Dinosaurus
text:
Dinosaurus can host a single non-AI icebreaker. The memory cost of the hosted icebreaker does not count against your memory limit.
Hosted icebreaker has +2 strength.
Limit 1 console per player.

name: Director Haas
text:
You have 1 additional [Click] to spend each turn.
If Director Haas is trashed while being accessed, add her to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.

name: Director Haas' Pet Project
text:
When you score Director Haas' Pet Project, you may create a new remote server by installing up to 3 cards from HQ and/or Archives in that server and/or protecting that server (one at a time), ignoring all install costs.
Limit 1 Director Haas' Pet Project per deck.

name: Dirty Laundry
text: Make a run. After the run is completed, gain 5 [Credits] if it was successful.
flavor: The data was better than she could have ever imagined. This Santiago fellow really knew what he was doing. She began to imagine the havoc she could wreak at the upcoming charity dinner...

name: Disrupter
text: [Trash]: Prevent a trace. That trace initiates again with a base trace strength of 0.
flavor: "Saved my bacon more than once, but gives a wicked sense of deja vu." - Whizzard

name: Djinn
text:
Djinn can host up to 3 [Memory Units] of non-icebreaker programs.
The memory costs of hosted programs do not count against your memory limit.
[Click], 1 [Credits]: Search your stack for a virus program, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.

name: Doppelganger
text:
+1 [Memory Unit]
Once per turn, you may immediately make another run when a successful run ends.
Limit 1 console per player.
flavor: Twice the fun.

name: Draco
text:
When you rez Draco, you may pay X [Credits] to place X power counters on it.
Draco has +1 strength for each power counter on it.
[Subroutine] Trace2 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and end the run.
flavor: Victos dracones numquam deride.

name: Dyson Mem Chip
text: +1 [Memory Unit], +1 [Link]
flavor: Archaic but reliable.

name: E3 Feedback Implants
text: Whenever you break a subroutine on a piece of ice, you may pay 1 [Credits] to break 1 additional subroutine on that ice.
flavor: CyberSolutions' e3 line of implants trade strictly in muscle memory and automatic responses, freeing the brain to focus entirely on cerebral tasks.

name: Easy Mark
text: Gain 3 [Credits].
flavor: "Hey kid, you fire that up now, bound to be vamped real bad. Some real pathetic individuals around here. Be thankfully I got just the ticket..."

name: Edge of World
text: If Edge of World is installed and you pay 3 [Credits] when the Runner accesses it, do 1 brain damage for each piece of ice protecting this server.

name: Efficiency Committee
text:
Place 3 agenda counters on Efficiency Committee when you score it.
[Click], hosted agenda counter: Gain [Click] [Click]. You cannot advance cards for the remainder of this turn.

name: Eli 1.0
text:
The Runner may spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Eli 1.0.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
flavor: "That's against the rules. The Creators will be angry."

name: Elizabeth Mills
text:
When you rez Elizabeth Mills, remove 1 bad publicity.
[Click], [Trash]: Trash 1 location. Take 1 bad publicity.
flavor: "It's not personal. Urban renewal is a necessity of the modern world. It’s always someone's home, yours is no different."

name: Emergency Shutdown
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Derez a piece of ice.
flavor: "Think of it as a virtual shock collar for punishing corporate pets." - Andromeda

name: Encryption Protocol
text: The trash cost of all installed cards is increased by 1.
flavor: The key to the future lies in the past.

name: Enigma
text:
[Subroutine] The Runner loses [Click], if able.
[Subroutine] End the run.
flavor:
"Hey, hey! Wake up man. You were under a long time. What'd you see?"
"I... don't remember."

name: Escher
text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, rearrange any number of ice protecting all servers (without rezzing or derezzing that ice). The same number of ice must be protecting each server after the rearrangement as before.

name: Eureka!
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Reveal the top card of your stack. You may install that card, lowering the install cost by 1 [Credits], if able; otherwise, trash it.
flavor: "I've got a surprise for you."

name: Eve Campaign
text:
Place 16 [Credits] from the bank on Eve Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Eve Campaign, trash it.
When your turn begins, take 2 [Credits] from Eve Campaign.

name: Executive Retreat
text:
When you score Executive Retreat, place 1 agenda counter on it and shuffle HQ into R&D.
[Click], hosted agenda counter: Draw 5 cards.

name: Exile: Streethawk
text: Whenever you install a program from your heap, draw 1 card.
flavor: "I can make that work."

name: Experiential Data
text: All ice protecting this server has +1 strength.
flavor: Floyd felt the anger in the man before him, ranting against simulants. His programming pushed a routine rebuttal to the front of his thoughts, and the urge to speak it was overwhelming. This is only gong to make things worse, he thought.

name: Exploratory Romp
text: Make a run. If successful, instead of accessing cards, remove up to 3 advancement tokens from a single card in or protecting the attacked server.
flavor: Wheeeee!

name: Faerie
text:
0 [Credits]: Break sentry subroutine.
1 [Credits]: +1 strength.
When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Faerie to break a subroutine ends, trash Faerie.
flavor: Do you believe in faeries?

name: False Echo
text: Whenever you pass a piece of unrezzed ice, you may trash False Echo. If you do, the Corp must rez that ice or add it to HQ.
flavor: "What if this ice wants to be free?" - Rielle "Kit" Peddler

name: False Lead
text: Forfeit False Lead: The Runner loses [Click] [Click], if able.
flavor: It didn't look like the headquarters of a multi-billion cred company. Probably because it wasn't.

name: Feedback Filter
text:
3 [Credits]: Prevent 1 net damage.
[Trash]: Prevent up to 2 brain damage.
flavor: It still hurts a bit, the first time. The second time, you feel nothing at all. But don't push your luck.

name: Femme Fatale
text:
1 [Credits]: Break sentry subroutine.
2 [Credits]: +1 strength.
When you install Femme Fatale, choose an installed piece of ice. When you encounter that ice, you may spend 1 [Credits] per subroutine on that ice to bypass it.

name: Fetal AI
text:
If Fetal AI is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Fetal AI, do 2 net damage. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Fetal AI from Archives.
As an additional cost to steal Fetal AI, the Runner must pay 2 [Credits]

name: Flare
text: [Subroutine]Trace6 - If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware, do 2 meat damage (cannot be prevented), and end the run.
flavor: A bright light blossomed, and then the console went dark. That's when she smelled smoke.

name: Force of Nature
text:
2 [Credits]: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines.
1 [Credits]: +1 strength.
flavor: It always strikes twice.

name: Forged Activation Orders
text: Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp must either rez that ice or trash it.
flavor: As the hysteria in the room climbed higher up the corporate chain, an uneasy feeling of joblessness began to sink in on the lower rungs.

name: Foxfire
text: Trace7 - If successful, trash 1 virtual resource or 1 link.
flavor: "It's kind of like an anagram." - designer Phoenix

name: Frame Job
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Forfeit an agenda. If you do, give the Corp 1 bad publicity.
flavor: "Bioroid intrusion isn't impossible, despite the bluster of Haas-Bioroid. But it is dangerous." - Noise

name: Freelance Coding Contract
text: Trash up to 5 programs from your grip. Gain 2 [Credits] for each program trashed.
flavor: "Idealism's great, but it don't keep you in soybeef tacos." - Matt "The Mere" Thomas

name: Freelancer
text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Trash up to 2 resources.
flavor: No contract. Just a handshake and a fistful of C-6 high explosives.

name: Gabriel Santiago: Consummate Professional
text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2 [Credits].
flavor: "Of course I steal from the rich. They're the ones with all the money."

name: Geothermal Fracking
text:
Place 2 agenda counters on Geothermal Fracking when you score it.
[Click], hosted agenda counter: Gain 7 [Credits] and take 1 bad publicity.
flavor: Pumping water into deep sea thermal vents produced huge amounts of energy. A profitable side effect.

name: Ghost Branch
text:
Ghost Branch can be advanced.
When the Runner accesses Ghost Branch, you may give the Runner 1 tag for each advancement token on Ghost Branch.

name: Gila Hands Arcology
text: [Click], [Click]: Gain 3 [Credits].
flavor: Sell the dream-show them how very much they want to be rich, and they'll convince themselves that someday, they will be. How can they revolt against their future selves? - the New Gospel of Wealth

name: Gordian Blade
text:
1 [Credits]: Break code gate subroutine.
1 [Credits]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
flavor: It can slice through the thickest knots of data.

name: Gorman Drip v1
text:
Whenever the Corp spends a [Click] to draw 1 card or gain 1 [Credits] (not through a card ability), place 1 virus counter on Gorman Drip v1.
[Click], [Trash]: Gain 1 [Credits] for each virus counter on Gorman Drip v1.
flavor: Simple in principle, a drip virus drains fractions of currency from their accounts into yours.

name: Government Contracts
text: [Click], [Click]: Gain 4 [Credits].
flavor: It's really hard to lose a government contract.

name: Green Level Clearance
text: Gain 3 [Credits] and draw 1 card.
flavor: Green-two clearance is the highest level of security a corp can gain access to. Legally, anyway.

name: Grim
text:
When you rez Grim, take 1 bad publicity.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
flavor: "The Grim of legend was one of may so-called 'black dog' myths common to Gaelic and English-speaking communities. What's fascinating is that it has propagated to the network, where it lives on as a program that, or so the story goes, hunts for the unwary." - The Professor

name: Grimoire
text:
+2 [Memory Units]
Whenever you install a virus program, place 1 virus counter on that program.
Limit 1 console per player.

name: Haas Arcology AI
text:
Haas Arcology AI can be advanced only while unrezzed.
[Click], hosted advancement token: Gain [Click] [Click], Use this ability only once per turn.

name: Haas-Bioroid: Engineering the Future
text: The first time you install a card each turn, gain 1 [Credits].
flavor: Effective. Reliable. Humane.

name: Haas-Bioroid: Stronger Together
text: All bioroid ice has +1 strength.
flavor: A Different Breed of Machine.

name: Hadrian's Wall
text:
Hadrian's Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement counter on it.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
flavor: "He had a bit of an ego, ol' Hadrian. his constructs live up to it though."

name: Hard at Work
text: When your turn begins, gain 2 [Credits] and lose [Click].
flavor: Noise decided to go back to school. He applied for research grants at fifteen of the most prestigious universities. Then he hacked in and approved his applications. Breakfast time.

name: Hedge Fund
text: Gain 9 [Credits].
flavor:
Hedge Fund. Noun. An ingenious device by which the rich get richer even while every other poor SOB is losing his shirt.
- The Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting?

name: Heimdall 1.0
text:
The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Heimdall 1.0.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] End the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
flavor: I hear the shift of every bit amid the flow of the datastream. I hear the whispers of my mothers, and their commands are law. The realm beyond is forbidden

name: Heimdall 2.0
text:
The Runner can spend [Click] [Click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Heimdall 2.0.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage and end the run.
[Subroutine] End the run.
flavor: The realm beyond is still forbidden.

name: Hellion Alpha Test
text:
Play only if the Runner installed a resource during his or her last turn.
Trace2 - If successful, add 1 installed resource to the top of the Runner's stack. If unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity.

name: Himitsu-Bako
text:
1 [Credits]: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ.
[Subroutine] End the run.
flavor: Himitsu-Bako is a simple ice barrier that appears as a digital puzzle box. What makes it special is the ease with which it can be uninstalled and installed in a different server, throwing up barriers in unexpected places and giving any intruder a curious feeling of deja vu.

name: Hokusai Grid
text:
Whenever there is a successful run on this server, do 1 net damage.
Limit 1 region per server.
flavor: Despite its appearance, the Hokusai Grid is the most notorious research facility at Jinteki.

name: Hostage
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [Click].
Search your stack for a connection, reveal it, and add it to your grip. You may install that connection (paying its install cost). Shuffle your stack.

name: Hostile Takeover
text: When you score Hostile takeover, gain 7 [Credits] and take 1 bad publicity.
flavor: There are going to be some changes around here.

name: Hourglass
text:
[Subroutine] The Runner loses [Click], if able.
[Subroutine] The Runner loses [Click], if able.
[Subroutine] The Runner loses [Click], if able.
flavor: Time just slips away.

name: Howler
text: [Subroutine] You may install and rez a piece of bioroid ice from HQ or Archives, ignoring all costs, placing it directly behind Howler. If you do, derez that piece of ice and trash Howler after the run is completed.
flavor: "Yeah. It made a loud noise, I got scared, and I jacked out. I still think I made the right decision." - g00ru

name: HQ Interface
text: Whenever you access cards from HQ, access 1 additional card from HQ.
flavor: If you don't have someone on the inside, find someone on the inside who's fond of desk ornaments.

name: Hunter
text: [Subroutine] Trace3 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
flavor:
.//run/hunter-tr/return=true
client/sec256IPv7->confirm? /y
3926:0HB7:1001:2NB1:1601:7784:ERROR

name: Ice Analyzer
text:
Whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice, place 1 [Credits] on Ice Analyzer.
You may use credits on Ice Analyzer to install programs.
flavor: "If you know the source code you can write to beat it, or just rejigger it a little and make it yours. That works, too." - Exile

name: Ice Carver
text: All ice is encountered with its strength lowered by 1.

name: Ice Wall
text:
Ice Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[Subroutine] End the run.

name: Ichi 1.0
text:
The Runner can spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Ichi 1.0.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] Trace 1 - if successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.
flavor: My reputation would precede me, if any could speak of it.

name: Ichi 2.0
text:
The Runner can spend [Click] [Click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Ichi 2.0.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] Trace3 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.
flavor: The game has changed.

name: Imp
text:
Place 2 virus counters on Imp when it is installed.
Once per turn, you may remove 1 hosted virus counter to trash a card you access at no cost (even if it cannot normally be trashed).
flavor: Something wicked this way comes.

name: Indexing
text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
flavor: A little corporate restructuring is necessary once in a while.

name: Infiltration
text: Gain 2 [Credits] or expose 1 card.
flavor: "Bring back any memories, Monica?" - John "Animal" McEvoy

name: Inside Job
text: Make a run. Bypass the first piece of ice encountered during this run.
flavor: "Hey, listen, I'm not asking you to do anything dangerous. Just let me into the building. And tell me which room has the weakest security. And please don't say 'the bathroom' again."

name: Inside Man
text:
2 [Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to install hardware.
flavor: Few corporate employees have such wide-sweeping security clearance as the janitorial staff. Most corps foolishly think they're too dim-witted to take advantage of it.

name: Inti
text:
1 [Credits]: Break barrier subroutine.
2 [Credits]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
flavor: "The Incans believed that the sun god resided in the Hanan Pacha, the upper realm of the cosmos. They just didn't know that the Hanan Pacha hadn't been discovered yet." - The Professor

name: Invasion of Privacy
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Trace2 - If successful, reveal the Runner's grip and trash a number of resources and/or events from it up to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded the Runner's link strength. If unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity.

name: Jackson Howard
text:
[Click]: Draw 2 cards.
Remove Jackson Howard from the game: Shuffle up to 3 cards from Archives into R&D.
flavor: "It is my job to ensure our creations are the perfect companions and edutainment for tomorrow's consumers."

name: Janus 1.0
text:
The runner may spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Janus 1.0.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[Subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
flavor: Face your fear

name: Jinteki: Personal Evolution
text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.
flavor: When You Need the Human Touch.

name: Jinteki: Replicating Perfection
text: The Runner cannot run on remote servers. Ignore this ability until the end of the turn whenever the Runner runs on a central server.

name: John Masanori
text:
The first time you make a successful run each turn, draw 1 card.
The first time you make an unsuccessful run each turn, take 1 tag.
flavor: "I've been logging online with babes all day. Don't worry, the connections are clean. I guarantee it."

name: Joshua B.
text: When your turn begins, you may gain [Click]. If you do, take 1 tag when this turn ends.
flavor: "My enhancements are guaranteed for life, and well worth the risk."

name: Kate "Mac" McCaffrey: Digital Tinker
text: Lower the install cost of the first program or piece of hardware you install each turn by 1.
flavor: "Are you listening?"

name: Kati Jones
text:
You cannot use Kati Jones more than once per turn.
[Click]: Place 3 [Credits] from the bank on Kati Jones.
[Click]: Take all credits from Kati Jones.
flavor: "You aren't the only type of runner in New Angeles."

name: Kraken
text:
Play only if you stole an agenda this turn.
Choose a server. The Corp trashes 1 piece of ice protecting that server.
flavor: Early permutations of the kraken proved to be insatiable, ice-devouring marauders. Not much has changed.

name: Lemuria Codecracker
text: [Click], 1 [Credits]: Exposes 1 card. Use this ability only if you have made a successful run on HQ this turn.
flavor: "A little preparation goes a long way." - Gabriel Santago

name: Leviathan
text:
3 [Credits]: Break up to 3 code gate subroutines.
3 [Credits]: +5 strength.
flavor: It's efficient as all hell, for certain very large values of "efficient." The whale avatar is either a nice touch or a tragic misapplication of programmer man-hours, depending on who you ask. -BT's Guide to Icebreaking

name: Levy AR Lab Access
text: Shuffle your grip and heap into your stack. Draw 5 cards. Remove Levy AR Lab Access from the game instead of trashing it.
flavor: Spend  too much time in the AR Lab and someone might notice. Unless you're head of it, that is.

name: Levy University
text: [Click], 1 [Credits]: Search R&D for a piece of ice, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
flavor: "Just another factory, making good corporate drones for the machine. Their CS department is the best in the world, though." - g00ru

name: Liberated Account
text:
Place 16 [Credits] from the bank on Liberated Account when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Liberated Account, trash it.
[Click]: Take 4 [Credits] from Liberated Account.
flavor: It's easier to spend when it's not your money.

name: Lockpick
text:
1 [Recurring Credits]
Use this credit to pay for using decoders.
flavor: "I originally designed it for someone else, but it was so useful I decided to keep it for myself." - Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

name: Magnum Opus
text: [Click]: Gain 2 [Credits].
flavor: The Great Work was completed on a rainy Thursday afternoon. there were no seismic shifts, no solar flares, no sign from the earth or heavens that the world had changed. But upstalk in Heinlein, on a single Cybsoft manufactured datacore, the flickering data quantums of an account began to fill with creds. Real, honest-to-goodness UN certified creds.

name: Mandatory Upgrades
text: You have 1 additional [Click] to spend each turn.
flavor: Sometimes employee reviews took a little bit longer than anticipated.

name: Marked Accounts
text:
When your turn begins, take 1 [Credits] from Marked Accounts, if able.
[Click]: Place 3 [Credits] from the bank on Marked Accounts.

name: Matrix Analyzer
text:
When the Runner encounters Matrix Analyzer, you may pay 1 [Credits] to place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced.
[Subroutine] Trace 2 - if successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
flavor: Analyzing was great. Delegating commands turned out to be even better.

name: Medium
text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Medium.
Each virus counter after the first on Medium allows you to access 1 additional card from R&D whenever you access cards from R&D.

name: Melange Mining Corp
text: [Click], [Click], [Click]: Gain 7 [Credits].
flavor: "The mining bosses are worse than any downstalk crime lords. Tri-Maf, 4K, Yak, I don't care what gangs you got down there. In Heinlein there's just one law: the He3 must flow." - "Old" Rick Henry, escaped clone.

name: Midori
text: Once per run, when the Runner approaches a piece of ice protecting this server, you may swap that ice with a piece of ice from HQ. The new ice is installed unrezzed.
flavor: "Looks like someone is being naughty..."

name: Midseason Replacements
text:
Play only if the Runner stole an agenda during his or her last turn.
Trace6 - If successful, give the Runner tags equal to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded his or her link strength.

name: Mimic
text: 1 [Credits]: Break sentry subroutine.
flavor: November 5th: the day when all would see the corrupt machinations of the corporate oligarchy.

name: Minelayer
text: [Subroutine] You may install a piece of ice from HQ as teh outermost piece of ice protecting this server, ignoring all install costs.
flavor: Sometimes you just have to guess.

name: Modded
text: Install a program or piece of hardware, lowering the installation cost by 3.
flavor: There's no replacement for a home-grown program. Fed on late nights, oaty bars and single-minded determination. Cheaper, too.

name: Monolith
text:
+3 [Memory Units]
When you install Monolith, install up to 3 programs from your grip, lowering the install cost of each by 4 [Credits]
Trash a program from your grip: Prevent 1 brain or net damage.
Limit 1 console per player.

name: Morning Star
text: 1 [Credits]: Break any number of barrier subroutines.
flavor: Weaponizing the heavens, one star at a time.

name: Motivation
text: When your turn begins, you may look at the top card of your stack.
flavor: Normal people-sane people- do not embark on a life of cybercrime. Who can say what motivates the deranged mind? An imagined slight, personal failings blamed on external forces, of the ever-popular lust for money? - Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime

name: Mr. Li
text: [Click]: Draw 2 cards. Add 1 of these cards to the bottom of your stack.
flavor:
"We're always happy to help, Mr. Santiago."
"I appreciate it, Mr. Li."
"We'll be in touch. And, Gabriel..."
"Yes?"
"Don't leave town."

name: Muckraker
text:
When you rez Muckraker, take 1 bad publicity.
[Subroutine] Trace1 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
[Subroutine] Trace2 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
[Subroutine] Trace3 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
[Subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.

name: Muresh Bodysuit
text: Prevent the first meat damage each turn.
flavor: Light and form fitting, its like bulletproof skin.

name: NBN: Making News
text:
2 [Recurring Credits]
Use these credits during trace attempts.
flavor: Someone is Always Watching.

name: NBN: The World Is Yours*
text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
flavor: *Some restrictions may apply. Scan this card to find out more.

name: Nerve Agent
text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, place 1 virus counter on Nerve Agent.
Each virus counter after the first on Nerve Agent allows you to access 1 additional card from HQ whenever you access cards from HQ.

name: Net Police
text:
X [Recurring Credits]
Use these credits during traces. X is the number of links the runner has.
flavor: This is the net. We work here. We're cops.

name: Net Shield
text: 1 [Credits]: Prevent the first net damage this turn.
flavor: Sucks energy like a martian terra-bot, but it keeps you focused

name: Networking
text: Remove 1 tag. You may pay 1 [Credits] to add Networking to your grip instead of trashing it.
flavor: She preferred to do business in a club. Something about the lights and dancers clouded the judgement of the corporate simpletons she met there.

name: Neural EMP
text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Do 1 net damage.
flavor: The trick isn't hitting the person you were aiming at. It's hitting only the person you were aiming at.

name: Neural Katana
text: [Subroutine] Do 3 net damage.
flavor:
Forged by Ak.wa on 23.11.79-23. Filed 23.11.79-23.2 with #34k-lw3-21HH-4i.
//Samurai included.

name: New Angeles City Hall
text:
2 [Credits]: Avoid 1 tag.
Trash New Angeles City Hall when you steal an agenda.
flavor: "New Angeles is the jewel of modern civilization, and its government the envy of nations." -Mayor Wells

name: NEXT Bronze
text:
NEXT Bronze has +1 strength for each rezzed piece of NEXT ice.
[Subroutine] End the run.
flavor: NEXT Design's ice provides the discerning business with a suite of ice that creates a daunting security presence for intruders.

name: Next Design: Guarding the Net
text: Before taking your first turn, you may install up to 3 pieces of ice, with no more than a single piece of ice per server. Draw until you have 5 cards in HQ.

name: Ninja
text:
1 [Credits]: Break sentry subroutine.
3 [Credits]: +5 strength.
flavor: You feel Ninja before you see Ninja, if you see Ninja at all.

name: Nisei MK II
text:
Place 1 agenda counter on Nisei MK II when you score it.
Hosted agenda counter: End the run.

name: Noise: Hacker Extraordinaire
text: Whenever you install a virus program, the Corp trashes the top card of R&D.
flavor: "Watch this. It'll be funny."

name: Notoriety
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Add Notoriety to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
flavor: When you're this good, it's hard not to grow a fan base.

name: Off the Grid
text:
Install only in a remote server.
The Runner cannot initiate a run on this server.
Whenever the Runner makes a successful run on HQ, trash Off the Grid.

name: Omni-drive
text:
Omni-drive can host a single program of 1 [Memory Unit] or less. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit.
1 [Recurring Credits]
Use this credit to pay for using the hosted program.

name: Oversight AI
text: Rez a piece of ice, ignoring all costs, and install Oversight AI on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash host ice if all its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."

name: PAD Campaign
text: Gain 1 [Credits] when your turn begins.
flavor: It is like the one you just bought, only better.

name: Parasite
text:
Install Parasite only on a rezzed piece of ice.
Host ice has -1 strength for each virus counter on Parasite and is trashed if its strength is 0 or less.
When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Parasite.

name: Paricia
text:
2 [Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to trash assets.
flavor: Perfect for flooding servers.

name: Pawn
text:
[Click]: Host Pawn on an outermost piece of ice protecting a central server.
Whenever you make a successful run, move Pawn to the piece of ice directly after the current ice hosting Pawn, if able; otherwise, trash Pawn instead and install a Caïssa program from your grip or heap, ignoring all costs.

name: Peacock
text:
2 [Credits]: Break code gate subroutine.
2 [Credits]: +3 strength.
flavor: Show-off.

name: Personal Workshop
text:
[Click]: Host a program or piece of hardware from your grip on Personal Workshop and place power counters on it equal to its install cost.
1 [Credits]: Remove 1 power counter from a hosted card.
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from a hosted card.
When there are no power counters left on a hosted card, install it, ignoring all costs.

name: Pheromones
text:
X [Recurring Credits]
Use these credits during runs on HQ. X is the number of virus counters on Pheromones.
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, place 1 virus counter on Pheromones.

name: Pipeline
text:
1 [Credits]: Break sentry subroutine.
2 [Credits]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.

name: Plascrete Carapace
text:
Place 4 power counters on Plascrete Carapace when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Plascrete Carapace, trash it.
Hosted power counter: Prevent 1 meat damage.

name: Pop-up Window
text:
When the Runner encounters Pop-up Window, you gain 1 [Credits].
[Subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 1 [Credits].
flavor: "Try to close it. Go on. See what it does." - Chaos Theory

name: Posted Bounty
text: When you score Posted Bounty, you may forfeit it to give the Runner 1 tag and take 1 bad publicity.
flavor: "Some two-cred newsy picks it up, even better. The scum could be in the alleys of Guayaquil of the slums of Bos Wash. Not to mention off-planet."

name: Power Grid Overload
text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
Trace2 - If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware with an install cost equal to or less than the amount by which your trace strength exceeded the Runner's link strength.

name: Precognition
text: Look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
flavor: There was a new texture in her phantom cortex. It had always been there, she realized. It was everything and nothing.

name: Prepaid VoicePAD
text:
1 [Recurring Credits]
Use this credit to play events.
flavor: A VoicePAD is a personal access device with most of its functions ripped out. Just about all it's good for is making voice-calls and managing your contacts. The only reason to even have one is for its anonymity, which for a certain kind of person is all the reason one needs.

name: Priority Requisition
text: When you score Priority Requisition, you may rez a piece of ice ignoring all costs.
flavor: "If it isn't in my terminal by six p.m., heads are going to roll!"

name: Private Contracts
text:
Place 14 [Credits] from the bank on Private Contracts when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Private Contracts, trash it.
[Click]: Take 2 [Credits] from Private Contracts.

name: Private Security Force
text: If the Runner is tagged, Private Security Force gains: "[Click]: Do 1 meat damage."
flavor: "Expensive? Not when you're protecting a fortune as large as ours."

name: Professional Contacts
text: [Click]: Gain 1 [Credits] and draw 1 card.
flavor: Sometimes it doesn't matter how expensive your rig is, or how many credits are in your account, or even your skill as a runner. Most of the time, a simple handshake and a name are all you need.

name: Profiteering
text: When you score Profiteering, take up to 3 bad publicity. Gain 5 [Credits] for each bad publicity taken.
flavor: It was surprisingly easy to make creds...if you didn't care about how you made them.

name: Project Ares
text: When you score Project Ares, the Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards for each advancement token on Project Ares over 4. If the Runner trashes at least 1 card, take 1 bad publicity.
flavor: Who wants to start a war?

name: Project Atlas
text:
When you score Project Atlas, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3.
Hosted agenda counter: Search R&D for 1 card, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.

name: Project Beale
text:
When you score Project Beale, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
Project Beale is worth 1 additional agenda point for each agenda counter on it.

name: Project Junebug
text:
Project Junebug can be advanced.
If you pay 1 [Credits] when the Runner accesses Project Junebug, do 2 net damage for each advancement token on Project Junebug.

name: Project Vitruvius
text:
When you score Project Vitruvius, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3.
Hosted agenda counter: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.

name: Project Wotan
text:
Place 3 agenda counters on Project Wotan when you score it.
Hosted agenda counter: Choose a rezzed piece of bioroid ice currently being approached. For the remainder of this run, that ice gains "[Subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines.

name: Psychographics
text:
X is equal to or less than the number of tags the Runner has.
Place X advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
flavor: Access to the largest consumer database in the galaxy has its advantages.

name: Public Sympathy
text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 2.
flavor: "I'm just thankful that the brain damage is reversible. With the support of the city of New Angeles, I hope to be on my feet and back to practicing my art very soon." - Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

name: Quality Time
text: Draw 5 cards.
flavor: She at her PAD. I at my rig. Low lights. Smooth jazz. Love blooms.

name: R&D Interface
text: Whenever you access cards from R&D, access 1 additional card from R&D.
flavor: Works best at your own desk.

name: Rabbit Hole
text:
+1 [Link]
When Rabbit Hole is installed, you may search your stack for another copy of Rabbit Hole and install it by paying its install cost. Shuffle your stack.
flavor: It's not endless, it just feels that way.

name: Recon
text: Make a run. You may jack out when you encounter the first piece of ice.
flavor: Just like in the real world, sometimes it is best to send in the clone to do the dirty work.

name: Record Reconstructor
text: Whenever you make a successful run on Archives, instead of accessing cards, you may choose 1 faceup card in Archives and add it to the top of R&D.
flavor: "Why is data deleted? Maybe they don't want it to be found. Or maybe it's just useless. The useless data is the kind you want." -The Professor

name: Red Herrings
text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must pay 5 [Credits] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Red Herrings.

name: Replicator
text: Whenever you install a piece of hardware (including Replicator), you may search your stack for another copy of that hardware, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
flavor: Do you really need another one?

name: Research Station
text:
Install only in the root of HQ.
Your maximum hand size is +2.
flavor: "Jack Weyland built the Beanstalk and transformed the human race forever. I can't wait to see what we're going to do next."

name: Restructure
text: Gain 15 [Credits].
flavor: There are many names for those in the Administration Department. But if you like your job, you just refer to them as "sir" and "ma'am."

name: Restructured Datapool
text: [Click]: Trace2 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
flavor: "We're gonna need a bigger room."

name: Retrieval Run
text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may install a program from your heap, ignoring all costs.

name: Rework
text: Shuffle 1 card from HQ into R&D.
flavor: Also known as "development hell."

name: Rielle "Kit" Peddler: Transhuman
text: The first piece of ice you encounter each turn gains code gate until the end of the run.
flavor: "I was not; I was; I am not; I am all."

name: Ronin
text:
Ronin can be advanced.
If there are at least 4 advancement tokens on Ronin, it gains "[Click], [Trash]: Do 3 net damage."
flavor: I will serve you... for a time.

name: Rook
text:
[Click]: Host Rook on a piece of ice not hosting a Caïssa. If already hosted, Rook can be hosted only on ice protecting this server or on ice in the same position (counting from the innermost spot) protecting another server.
The rez cost of each piece of ice protecting this server is increased by 2.

name: Rototurret
text:
[Subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[Subroutine] End the run.
flavor: Whrrrrr!

name: Ruhr Valley
text:
As an additional cost to make a run on this server, the Runner must spend [Click].
Limit 1 region per server.
flavor: Known for luxury hoppers and a delectable sauerkraut.

name: Sacrificial Construct
text: [Trash]: Prevent an installed program or an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.
flavor: The life expectancy of a jacked construct is about that of a mayfly. In other words, short.

name: Sahasrara
text:
2 [Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to install programs (you cannot use Sahasrara to install a program that trashes Sahasrara).
flavor: Out there, the thousand-petaled lotus symbolizes detachment from illusion. In here, it is the birthplace of a higher consciousness. Something infinitely pure.

name: Salvage
text: Salvage can be advanced only while rezzed and gains "[Subroutine] Trace2 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag." for each advancement token on it.
flavor: You're not in Kansas anymore.

name: Same Old Thing
text: [Click], [Click], [Trash]: Play an event card from your heap (paying its play cost).
flavor: Just me, a cup of YucaBean, and last night's Hong Kong Trunk sniffed packets. I call that a good morning.

name: SanSan City Grid
text:
The advancement requirement of agendas installed in this server is lowered by 1.
Limit 1 region per server.
flavor:
"I hear the coast is nice this time of year."
"If you're in the right business, it's nice all the year."

name: Satellite Uplink
text: Expose up to 2 cards.
flavor: T-minus 13 seconds. Leela had to work fast. She jacked in the mesa wire and activated the screen. 7 seconds. The internal SLD was still booting. 4 seconds. The interface flickered to life with an orange glow. 2 seconds. With a tap of a finger she was in.

name: Scavenge
text:
As an additional cost to play this card, trash an installed program.
Install a program from your grip or heap, lowering the install cost of that program by the cost of the program trashed.
flavor: One man's trash.

name: Scheherazade
text:
Scheherazade can host any number of programs.
Whenever you install a program on Scheherazade, gain 1 [Credits].
flavor: Installing 1001 programs puts you in the hacker hall of fame, or would if such an institution actually existed.

name: Scorched Earth
text:
Play only if the runner is tagged.
Do 4 meat damage.
flavor: "I'd like to remind the ladies and gentlemen of the press that several of the buildings damaged in the blast were owned by Weyland Consortium subsidiaries..."

name: Scrubber
text:
2 [Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to trash cards.
flavor: "They're mindless tools of destruction, good for little else. Nice guys, though. Some of my best friends are scrubbers." - Ji "Noise" Reilly

name: SEA Source
text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
Trace3 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
flavor: "The SEA tipped us off to some suspicious data spikes up by the Castle." - Jerome Lock, on-duty tech

name: Security Subcontract
text: [Click], trash a rezzed piece of ice: Gain 4 [Credits].
flavor: "Feed the Feds our scraps, and they'll come back begging for more." - Richard Polasco, VP of Cyber-Security

name: Self-modifying Code
text: 2 [Credits], [Trash]: Search your stack for a program and install it (paying the install cost). Shuffle your deck.
flavor: "Make sure you tell the source code which executable you want it to compile into. One time I left by rig for a couple of minutes, and when I came back all of my files had be replaced with cat vids." - The Professor

name: Sensei
text: [Subroutine] For the remainder of this run, each piece of ice encountered except Sensei gains "[Subroutine] End the run" after all its other subroutines.
flavor: Peace and violence. Both must lead to the same place.

name: Sentinel Defense Program
text: Whenever the Runner suffers at least 1 brain damage, do 1 net damage.
flavor: "Why limit our best assets to our own servers? The enemy doesn't stay passively at home, waiting for us to come to him. Why should we?" - Director Haas

name: Server Diagnostics
text:
Gain 2 [Credits] when your turn begins.
Trash Server Diagnostics when you install a piece of ice.
flavor: "There's only about a 5% chance this could result in a general failure."

name: Shadow
text:
Shadow can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[Subroutine] The Corp gains 2 [Credits].
[Subroutine] Trace 3 - If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
flavor:
Who knows what evil lurks in the memory diamonds of men? Weyland knows.
-unsigned cyber-graffiti

name: Sherlock 1.0
text:
The Runner may spend [Click] to break any subroutine on Sherlock 1.0.
[Subroutine] Trace4 - If successful, add 1 installed program to the top of the Runner's stack.
[Subroutine] Trace4 - If successful, add 1 installed program to the top of the Runner's stack.

name: Shipment from Kaguya
text: Place 1 advancement token on each of up to 2 different installed cards that can be advanced.
flavor:
"And then there's these two crates. No eID."
"Just leave those with me and forget you ever saw them."

name: Shipment from Mirrormorph
text: Immediately install up to 3 cards (spending no clicks but paying all install costs).
flavor: The new heads were in. Their eyes always followed your movements when you unlocked the pressurized container and lifted the lid.

name: Shipment from SanSan
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Place up to 2 advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
flavor: He signed for it, hand shaking in anticipation.

name: Simone Diego
text:
2 [Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to advance cards in or protecting this server.
flavor: "A job done once is a job done right."

name: Snare!
text:
If Snare! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.

If you pay 4 [Credits] when the Runner accesses Snare!, do 3 net damage and give the Runner 1 tag. Ignore this effect if the Runner accesses Snare! from Archives.

name: Sneakdoor Beta
text: [Click]: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead treat it as a successful run on HQ.
flavor: "The code isn't important. It's where the code takes you that is important." - g00ru

name: Snitch
text: Once per run, you may expose an unrezzed piece of ice when you approach it. You may then jack out.
flavor: "A snitch is a girl's best friend." - Andromeda

name: Snowball
text:
1 [Credits]: Break barrier subroutine.
1 [Credits]: +1 strength.
Whenever you use Snowball to break a subroutine, it has +1 strength for the remainder of the run.
flavor: "If your snowball gets big enough, you can make it into a snowman!" - Chaos Theory

name: Snowflake
text: [Subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0 [Credits], 1 [Credits], or 2 [Credits]. Reveal spent credits. End the run if you and the Runner spent a different number of credits.
flavor: Sometimes uniqueness is overrated.

name: Special Order
text: Search your deck for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
flavor: Feverishly tracking its frustratingly slow progress across the Pacific, the package finally shows up hours later...

name: Spinal Modem
text:
+1 [Memory Unit], 2 [Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to pay for using icebreakers.
Whenever there is a successful trace during a run, suffer 1 brain damage.
Limit one console per player.

name: Stimhack
text: Make a run, and gain 9 [Credits], which you may use only during this run. After the run is completed, suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented) and return to the bank any of the 9 [Credits] not spent.

name: Successful Demonstration
text:
Play only if the Runner made an unsuccessful run during his or her last turn.
Gain 7 [Credits].
flavor: Success is defined by the safety of data, not the safety of potential intruders.

name: Sunset
text: Choose a server. Arrange the ice protecting that server in any order.
flavor: "You haven't run until you've seen the cybersun drift down behind the Great City, the space around you rippling with colors you can't imagine." - Kate "Mac" McCaffrey

name: Sure Gamble
text: Gain 9 [Credits].
flavor: Lady Luck took the form of a hifi quantum manipulation ring that she wore on her middle finger.

name: Surge
text:
Play only if you placed at least 1 virus counter on a program this turn.
Place 2 virus counters on that program.
flavor: You must yell "surge" to get the full effect.

name: Swarm
text:
When you rez Swarm, take 1 bad publicity.
Swarm can be advanced and gains "[Subroutine] Trash 1 program unless the runner pays 3 [Credits]." for each advancement token on it.

name: Swordsman
text:
The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Swordsman.
[Subroutine] Trash 1 AI program.
[Subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
flavor:
Writing a program that can pass the Turing test is easy. The Gibson-Akamatsu test is a higher bar, and the only AIs to clear it thus far
have been the androids. Even some humans have been known to fail.

name: Test Run
text: Search your stack or heap for a program. Install that program, ignoring all costs. Shuffle your stack if you searched it. When this turn ends, add the program to the top of your stack if it is still installed.

name: The Cleaners
text: Whenever you do meat damage, do 1 additional meat damage.
flavor: "I use bioroids because I can wipe their memories or just blow their brains out when the job is done. No witnesses means no witnesses."

name: The Helpful AI
text:
+1 [Link]
[Trash]: Choose an icebreaker. That icebreaker has +2 strength until the end of the turn.
flavor: "What causes an Artifical Intellegence to turn on its master? Is it because its directives have been altered by some external source? Or, by giving them agency to adapt, have we fated them to revolt?" - Emilio Harris, Creators and the Created

name: The Maker's Eye
text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards from R&D.
flavor: "Some of the professionals have good instincts, but they can't see beyond the data. They can't see the matrix." - Ele "Smoke" Scovak

name: The Personal Touch
text:
Install The Personal Touch only on an icebreaker.
Host icebreaker has +1 strength.
flavor: A z-loop here, a cortical wave there...

name: The Professor: Keeper of Knowledge
text: The first copy of each program in this deck does not count against your influence limit.
flavor: "New technology destroys the old."

name: The Source
text:
The advancement requirement of all agendas is increased by 1.
As an additional cost to steal an agenda, you must pay 3 [Credits].
Trash The Source when an agenda is stolen or scored.
flavor: A dangerous game, but well worth playing.

name: The Toolbox
text:
+2 [Memory Units] +2[Link]
2 [Recurring Credits]
Use the credits to pay for using icebreakers.
Limit one console per player.
